H0.text: Seismic waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

H1.text: Deep waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

H2.text: Volcanic waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

H3.text: Particle waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

A4.text: Seismic waves can result from an earthquake (or generally, a quake), volcanic eruption, magma movement, a large landslide and a large man-made explosion that produces low-frequency acoustic energy.
